page.title: 13Entertainment in Sheerness
page.content: Sheerness once supported three {cinemas}and a{music hall}/ theatre within a half mile radius. These were the Rio, the Argosy, the Ritz and the Hippodrome. Today there is only one cinema which is privately owned and shares its building with a discotheque and snooker club. This decline in {entertainment}facilities is a reflection of the reduced demand since the closure of the naval dockyard. Sheppey Little{Theatre}is run and maintained by voluntary organisations. These people raised the money and converted a church into a theatre with seating for about 150 people. Amateur theatre groups and choirs present various works during the year. The theatre is also used by children from local clubs who produce an annual pantomime.
